intro: Nelitris billardierei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
